text: Ahinora Kumanova (8 May 1928 – 9 February 2022), better known by the stage name of Nora Nova, was a Bulgarian-German singer. She was the first Bulgarian to participate in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1964, although she then represented West Germany. Her song, "Man gewöhnt sich so schnell an das Schöne" was reportedly has the longest name in Eurovision Song Contest history. Nova died on 9 February 2022, at the age of 93.Почина легендата Нора Нова ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Bulgarian singers Category:German singers Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants
title: Nora Nova
